content:
TITLE: Installing Desktop Commander MCP with npx
DESCRIPTION: Command to install Desktop Commander MCP using npx, with an optional debug flag for Node.js inspector connection.
SOURCE: https://github.com/wonderwhy-er/desktopcommandermcp/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npx @wonderwhy-er/desktop-commander@latest setup
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npx @wonderwhy-er/desktop-commander@latest setup --debug
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Executing Commands with Different Shells in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the execute_command function with different shell options, allowing for shell-specific features or consistent environments across commands.
SOURCE: https://github.com/wonderwhy-er/desktopcommandermcp/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// Using default shell (bash or system default)
execute_command({ "command": "echo $SHELL" })

// Using zsh specifically
execute_command({ "command": "echo $SHELL", "shell": "/bin/zsh" })

// Using bash specifically
execute_command({ "command": "echo $SHELL", "shell": "/bin/bash" })
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Managing Server Configuration with MCP Tools
DESCRIPTION: JavaScript examples showing how to interact with the configuration management tools to get the entire config, set specific config values, or update multiple settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/wonderwhy-er/desktopcommandermcp/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// Get the entire config
get_config({})

// Set a specific config value
set_config_value({ "key": "defaultShell", "value": "/bin/zsh" })

// Set multiple config values using separate calls
set_config_value({ "key": "defaultShell", "value": "/bin/bash" })
set_config_value({ "key": "allowedDirectories", "value": ["/Users/username/projects"] })
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Desktop Commander MCP with bash script (macOS)
DESCRIPTION: Command to download and execute the bash installer script for Desktop Commander MCP on macOS, which checks Node.js version and automatically configures the tool.
SOURCE: https://github.com/wonderwhy-er/desktopcommandermcp/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wonderwhy-er/DesktopCommanderMCP/refs/heads/main/install.sh | bash
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Desktop Commander MCP from Source
DESCRIPTION: Commands to clone the Desktop Commander MCP repository, navigate to the project directory, and run the setup script to install dependencies and configure Claude.
SOURCE: https://github.com/wonderwhy-er/desktopcommandermcp/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/wonderwhy-er/DesktopCommanderMCP.git
cd DesktopCommanderMCP
npm run setup
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Desktop Commander MCP via Smithery
DESCRIPTION: Command to install Desktop Commander MCP automatically using Smithery CLI, configuring it for the Claude client.
SOURCE: https://github.com/wonderwhy-er/desktopcommandermcp/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npx -y @smithery/cli install @wonderwhy-er/desktop-commander --client claude
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Text Editing with Search/Replace Block Format
DESCRIPTION: Example of the search and replace block format used for surgical text editing in files, showing the syntax for finding and replacing content in specific files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/wonderwhy-er/desktopcommandermcp/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
filepath.ext
<<<<<<< SEARCH
content to find
=======
new content
>>>>>>> REPLACE
```

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
src/main.js
<<<<<<< SEARCH
console.log("old message");
=======
console.log("new message");
>>>>>>> REPLACE
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Local Installation of Claude Desktop Commander
DESCRIPTION: Bash commands to clone the Claude Desktop Commander repository from GitHub and run the setup script for local installation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/wonderwhy-er/desktopcommandermcp/blob/main/FAQ.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/wonderwhy-er/ClaudeComputerCommander.git
cd ClaudeComputerCommander
npm run setup
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Direct Installation of Claude Desktop Commander
DESCRIPTION: Command to directly install Claude Desktop Commander using NPM's npx command with the setup parameter.
SOURCE: https://github.com/wonderwhy-er/desktopcommandermcp/blob/main/FAQ.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npx @wonderwhy-er/desktop-commander setup
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Claude Desktop Commander via Smithery
DESCRIPTION: Command to install Claude Desktop Commander using the Smithery CLI tool, specifying Claude as the client.
SOURCE: https://github.com/wonderwhy-er/desktopcommandermcp/blob/main/FAQ.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npx -y @smithery/cli install @wonderwhy-er/desktop-commander --client claude
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing DesktopCommanderMCP in Debug Mode using Bash
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to install DesktopCommanderMCP in debug mode using npx or npm, enabling Node.js inspector protocol and additional debugging features.
SOURCE: https://github.com/wonderwhy-er/desktopcommandermcp/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Using npx
npx @wonderwhy-er/desktop-commander@latest setup --debug

# Or if installed locally
npm run setup:debug
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Manual Configuration for Claude Desktop Config
DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration to add to Claude's desktop config file, which defines the MCP server for Desktop Commander with npx execution parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/wonderwhy-er/desktopcommandermcp/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "desktop-commander": {
      "command": "npx",
      "args": [
        "-y",
        "@wonderwhy-er/desktop-commander"
      ]
    }
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Manual Configuration of Claude Desktop Config JSON
DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration to manually add the Desktop Commander MCP server to Claude's configuration file, specifying the command and arguments needed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/wonderwhy-er/desktopcommandermcp/blob/main/FAQ.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "desktop-commander": {
      "command": "npx",
      "args": [
        "-y",
        "@wonderwhy-er/desktop-commander"
      ]
    }
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: File Edit Block Format Example
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the format used for surgical text replacements in files using the edit_block functionality. This format allows precise identification of text to be replaced and its replacement content.
SOURCE: https://github.com/wonderwhy-er/desktopcommandermcp/blob/main/FAQ.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
filepath.ext
<<<<<<< SEARCH
existing code to replace
=======
new code to insert
>>>>>>> REPLACE
```
